I use Firefox for work and need to have a lot of tabs open, in a certain order, in a single window.

It also sometimes happens when I type in a text field on a tab and hit return. The tab "disappears" and I find it all the way to the right. It never used to do this in older versions of Firefox.

I don't think I'm doing something different than usual to trigger it. It just seems to be at random.

I really need to figure out how to stop Firefox from doing this. It's frustrating, disruptive, and slows down my work.

Thank you in advance for any help you can give.

title: Tabs keep crashing after clearing cache
content: A few days ago, trying to free up some memory and improve my computer's performance, I deleted the cache and tracking cookies from Firefox (using AVG TuneUp). Since then, I can only load a certain, variable number of tabs and/or pages without every new or reactivated tab or page claiming to have crashed (although about:crashes says that no reports have been submitted). Restoring those pages seems impossible without restarting Firefox or the whole computer. The problem persists in Troubleshoot mode, but as far as I can tell doesn't affect Chrome, although that used even more RAM. I've tried culling open tabs (of which I still probably have far too many, but it's never been an issue before), using the OneTab extension to reduce them to lists of URLs, disabling and re-enabling hardware acceleration, updating Firefox, checking for file corruption and RAM errors and even uninstalling and reinstalling the program, but nothing's worked so far. What might be going on, and what else can I try?
creator: elinor.macnab

title: Youtube tabs crashing
content:
Hi,

I built a new PC a few months ago.

On this PC, Youtube tabs occasionally crash - the problem is intermittent, but common enough to be annoying. I never saw this on my old PC.

As far as I can tell, most of the software is the same as my old PC. Hardware is different if that matters (went from an Intel processor to an AMD, otherwise the component manufacturers are mostly consistent).

Still using Firefox on Windows 11. It's almost always up-to-date and is often up-to-date when the issue occurs. My only add-ons are Reddit Enhancement Suite and uBlock Origin, both of which I used on the old PC.

When I first built it, I did have an issue where I used RAM that was incompatible with my motherboard - that has been resolved and tabs are still crashing. I had found some indication that it could be related to faulty or incompatible hardware, but everything else is working now since fixing the RAM incompatibility.

Sometimes the tab crashes with an error message, sometimes it will simply freeze and I have to entirely close out the tab and re-navigate to the URL of the video I was just watching. The whole browser does not crash - I checked about:crashes and did not see any info that I can confirm coincides with a Youtube tab crash.

I have only seen this issue with Youtube, no other websites.

Thanks for any help that can be provided.

title: problems with "translate selection"
content:
First, thanks for introducing this feature [which is not the same as whole page translation]. It fills the gap created when, years ago, Mozilla disabled a translation plug-in. IMHO it's not ready for prime time, because:

1. When I highlight a word or phrase then r-click and Translate, this feature offers to translate From English, To English. Don't need software to do that. Even if, on same web page, I set source language to Italian, when I try to translate another section, the tool defaults to no-op same language. For many years other translation tools have been fairly good at detecting source language. Do I really have to download languages for ONline translation (as in "Set your language and site translation preferences and manage languages downloaded for offline translation.")? Anyway, without language detection the tool loses much of its value.

2. Even once you make the effort to set source language, the translation is often wrong, sometimes simply repeating the selection.

So, nice idea, yes you say "Beta" but it feels more like "Alpha."

title: After syncing a new account, firefox is wiping my synced information on all devices
content:
Hi Y'all,

I have Firefox syncing to about 6 different systems (Windows, Mac, iOS) and have run into a situation where Firefox is wiping years of my synced data when I quit and restart Firefox. I sync all of items that can be synced and this has served me well for many years. What happened:

  1. I logged on the admin account of a Mac where I previously logged in before and used Firefox with sync enabled. The machine had the initial Firefox short cuts: AP, Amazon, etc.
  2. I enabled sync and did a 2FA but the my normal Firefox home page did not appear. So pressed the Sync now button to no effect.
  3. When Firefox started, I did see the usual message that "It looks like you haven't started Firefox in a while. Would you like to refresh Firefox." I think that I closed that message but I could have accidentally refreshed Firefox for that account on that system.
  4. I gave up and did what I needed to, closed Firefox, and logged out.
  5. That evening when I was using Firefox on a Windows machine I could see that the sync information reduced to almost nothing from before the last day. The day I saw the saw the same and started to worry.
  6. However, the Firefox on my main two Macs still had all the data. As a test, I deliberately closed Firefox on one of those two Macs. When I restarted, the synced data was wiped. This leads me to believe that somehow Mozilla's servers are holding the data based for the almost empty content of Firefox that I had on the administrative account that I synced.

So in other words rather than importing my data from Firefox when I connected sync, sync exported the settings of the Firefox account I was using in the admin account. I am writing this from my other main Mac which still has full information and I would like to force the synced information on this Mac to override or at least merge with what is on the Mozilla servers. Can this be done? I am 99% sure that if I close Firefox on this machine all my settings will be wiped. For now a I believe that I still have the correct sync data on at least this Mac, my iPhone, and few other Windows and Linux machines. I am in particular worried about losing the hundreds of passwords that I have saved. I forgot to check if the passwords were overwritten when I restarted the first Mac but I'll bet they were.

Thanks for any help...

Fred
creator: fredluehring

title: Unable to make Firefox default browser in Windows 10
content:
I've been using Firefox in Windows for years as my default browser. Suddenly tonight, Microsoft Edge became my default. When I go into Windows Settings and try to change back to Firefox, Windows offers me only Microsoft browsers as alternatives (or offers to let me into the Microsoft Store): Windows Edge or Internet Explorer.

The Control Panel / Settings page "Set Default Apps" is the only way that I know that Windows lets users set default browsers, but it suddenly seems to be restricting me to only MS browsers.

Firefox works normally in every other way, but warns me now every time I launch it that I have a different default browser. When I click the button in the warning (or in Firefox's Tools / Settings) I just get put back to the Windows "Set Default Apps" page, which, again, only lets me choose Microsoft browsers.

What could have happened? I haven't altered my Firefox configuration or installed extensions or plug-ins in a long time. If I uninstall & reinnstall Firefox, will I lose my many configuration & interface settings and will I have to reinstall all my extensions -- or will the reinstalled Firefox remember its existing configuration? Or would that probably not help at all.

I'm very computer-savvy, but have run out of ideas. Can you help??

DJL
creator: donlabzd

title: NS_ERROR_DOM_MEDIA_FATAL_ERR mGMP not initialized
content:
Hi

When I browse to https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/images/154162/clouds-hover-over-the-alaska-peninsula, I can play the shown video once.

When the video is about to start the 2nd time though, the log from the web developer tool says (see screenshot): ``` Media resource https://eoimages.gsfc.nasa.gov/images/imagerecords/154000/154162/ak_cloudwave_vir_20250407_anim.mp4 could not be decoded. clouds-hover-over-the-alaska-peninsula All candidate resources failed to load. Media load paused. clouds-hover-over-the-alaska-peninsula Media resource https://eoimages.gsfc.nasa.gov/images/imagerecords/154000/154162/ak_cloudwave_vir_20250407_anim.mp4 could not be decoded, error: Error Code: NS_ERROR_DOM_MEDIA_FATAL_ERR (0x806e0005) Details: virtual RefPtr<MediaDataDecoder::DecodePromise> mozilla::GMPVideoDecoder::Decode(MediaRawData *): mGMP not initialized ``` and the video shows the warning "No video with supported format and MIME type found.", although the video was successfully played the 1st time.

Note that the first four warnings in the screenshot already appear when loading the page, i.e. before playing the video the 1st time.

The same happens when all installed firefox plugins are disabled.

I am using firefox 137.0.1 (64 bit) on arch linux.

Thanks for help, Chris

title: Text input is hard to read due to dark block overlay while typing
content:
Hello,

I'm experiencing a visual issue when typing in text input fields (such as input boxes or textareas) in Firefox. While typing, a dark overlay or block appears behind the current word or text I'm typing, which makes it very hard to read. It looks like some kind of highlight or shadow, possibly related to spellcheck or text recognition.

This issue occurs across different websites and makes it uncomfortable to type for long periods. I'm currently using Firefox [137.0.2] on Windows 10.

I've attached a screenshot that shows the problem clearly.

Things I've tried so far: - Disabling spellcheck - Changing themes - Disabling extensions - Testing in private window

None of these solved the issue.

Notably, switching to the **light theme** makes the issue disappear — the text input background becomes clear and easy to read again. However, I prefer to use the **dark theme**, so I’m looking for a solution that works in dark mode as well.

Can anyone help identify what's causing this or suggest a way to disable this effect while keeping the dark theme?

Thanks in advance!
creator: peacepiece

title: Synced Tabs Still Appearing on Mobile Device
content: Hello there! I have Firefox on both my (Windows) laptop and (IOS) mobile device. Several months ago (January or February, maybe?) I had to delete Firefox from my laptop and reinstall it to fix an issue. No big deal. However, whenever I check my synced tabs on my mobile device, it still shows the tabs from before I uninstalled it on my laptop as well as the taps currently opened on my laptop. It appears as if they're two separate devices. I already checked the "Connected Services" section of my account settings, and my laptop does not appear twice. I was hoping someone could point me in the right direction of how to remove the previous version of Firefox from appearing on sync on my mobile device. TIA for any help!
